p: Gosling et al. [ 75], working on CIP resistance in E. coli isolated from turkeys, recorded a rate of multi-resistant isolates estimated at 88.1% with resistances, 100% for both CIP and NA, 94.4% for TE, and 84.9% for AMP in Great Britain; the only result that does not agree with ours is the sensitivity of these strains to AMC (92.8%).
